EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This material supersedes IRM 4.2.8 dated October 6, 2020

SB/SE National Quality Review

) General Overview. Field and Specialty Exam Quality (FSEQ) supports the Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE) quality improvement program, providing an assessment of the quality of Field and Specialty Examination case work. (
) Purpose. This IRM section contains general information and procedural guidance relating to the SB/SE Field and Specialty Exam National Quality Review program. (
) Audience. The audience is employees and management officials in FSEQ well as SB/SE stakeholders. (
) Policy Owner. The Director, Exam Quality and Technical Support responsible for the policies related to the National Quality Review program. Refer to IRM
, Exam Quality and Technical Support for more mation. (
) Program Owner. The Program Manager, FSEQ is responsible for the National Quality Review program. Refer to IRM
, Field Specialty Exam Quality for more information. (
) Program Goals. The goal of the National Quality Review program is to provide a practical and accurate method of assessing organizational perfor- mance in support of the balanced measures. (

) Primary Stakeholder. The Director Examination SB/SE. Additional ers are Directors located in: • Headquarters Examination • Field Examination • Field and Campus Policy • Specialty Policy • Specialty Tax (
) Contact Information. To recommend changes or make any other related to this IRM section, see
, Providing Feedback About an Section - Outside of Clearance (

) Embedded Quality (EQ) creates a link between individual performance and organizational goals. This linkage is achieved through a common set of butes that both national quality reviewers in FSEQ and front-line managers to evaluate the quality of case work. (
) EQ reviews focus on whether the examiner took the right actions at the time while protecting taxpayer rights. (

) National quality reviewers in FSEQ use the National Quality Review System (NQRS), an automated web-based system, to record results from case for the following programs: • Field and Office Examination • Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) • Employment Tax • Estate and Gift Tax • Excise Tax
for SB/SE National Quality Review 4.2.8
) Reports generated from NQRS provide data which may be used to organizational processes, procedures and successes, and identify areas in need of improvement. (
) The Quality Knowledge Base contains Examination Quality program tion, including Embedded Quality Review System (EQRS) and National Review System (NQRS) system guidance. (
) The Quality Knowledge Base is located at https://portal.ds.irsnet.gov/sites/ vl
/pages/default.aspx. (
) Managers use the Embedded Quality Review System (EQRS) database to evaluate employee performance. For more information regarding front-line manager use of EQRS see IRM
, Performance Feedback..
Note: NQRS data is never used to evaluate employee performance.
) IRM
, Policy Statement
, Principles of Quality, provides the tative basis for the procedures in this IRM. (
CFR

(b) states that quality measures focus on whether IRS personnel: • Devoted an appropriate amount of time to a matter • Properly analyzed the facts of the situation • Complied with statutory, regulatory and IRS procedures • Took timely actions • Provided adequate notiﬁcation and made required contacts with taxpayers (
) The Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) lists rights that already existed in the code, putting them in simple language and grouping them into
rights. Employees are responsible for being familiar with and acting in with taxpayer rights. See IRC
), Execution of Duties in Accord Taxpayer Rights. For additional information about the TBOR, see irs.gov/taxpayer-bill-of-rights. (
) Listed below are the primary roles and responsibilities of the FSEQ manager, quality analysts, management and quality reviewers involved in quality review process. (

) FSEQ program manager primary responsibilities include: • Overseeing and allocating resources for FSEQ • Coordinating the development of the annual case review sample for FSEQ • Ensuring that case review inventory is sufficient for each Field and Specialty Exam Area or program based on the sample plan • Monitoring the delivery of the Field and Specialty Exam national sampling plan • Coordinating issues relating to interpreting and rating the quality butes • Establishing protocol to measure, monitor, and improve reviewer accuracy and consistency Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
N

• Sharing analysis of NQRS data to aid in organizational and inﬂuence quality performance • Providing quality review data and/or analysis to internal/external holders on an ad hoc or recurring basis • Coordinating with stakeholders in the development of attributes and quirements for quality reviews • Providing recommendations to enhance NQRS (

) FSEQ analyst are responsible for: • Developing and distributing quality performance reports • Developing the annual case review sample plan • Reviewing attribute narratives on a regular basis to ensure are followed • Participating in group meetings to promote consistency, including discussion of speciﬁc attributes and case scenarios • Developing and clarifying review criteria and procedures to promote consistency • Providing quality review data and/or analysis to internal/external holders on an ad hoc or recurring basis • Coordinating with stakeholders in their quality improvement • Collaborating with stakeholders in the development of attributes and quirements for quality reviews • Working with stakeholders in monitoring and updating job aids, tional guides and quality review procedures in accordance with IRM program guidelines (

) FSEQ front-line manager responsibilities include: • Providing guidance for program objectives Manager • Ensuring reviewers understand and adhere to program guidelines • Ensuring accurate and consistent application of the quality • Reviewing attribute narratives on a regular basis to ensure are followed • Critiquing completed reviews on a regular basis and providing ful feedback to reinforce expectations for quality case reviews • Conducting group meetings to promote consistency, including the cussion of speciﬁc attributes and case scenarios • Ensuring accuracy of data input • Ensuring the sample plan is followed • Monitoring sample plan and recommending actions to address ances • Maintaining instructional guides for national quality reviewers • Reviewing and approving case returns that meet criteria found in
,Returning Cases to the Field. • Reviewing and approving rejection of cases that do not meet case sampling criteria found in IRM
and IRM
• Sharing trends and issues that may have nationwide impact • Providing input during the attribute development or update process (
) FSEQ reviewers responsibilities include: • Evaluating examination case quality by conducting reviews of SB/SE Field and Specialty Exam cases (

• Providing guidance for program objectives • Ensuring reviewers understand and adhere to program guidelines • Ensuring accurate and consistent application of the quality attributes • Reviewing attribute narratives on a regular basis to ensure guidelines are followed • Critiquing completed reviews on a regular basis and providing ful feedback to reinforce expectations for quality case reviews • Conducting group meetings to promote consistency, including the dis- cussion of speciﬁc attributes and case scenarios • Ensuring accuracy of data input • Ensuring the sample plan is followed • Monitoring sample plan and recommending actions to address imbal- ances • Maintaining instructional guides for national quality reviewers • Reviewing and approving case returns that meet criteria found in IRM

• Sharing trends and issues that may have nationwide impact • Providing input during the attribute development or update process FSEQ reviewers responsibilities include:
Evaluating examination case quality by conducting reviews of completed SB/SE Field and Specialty Exam cases

General Examining • Accurately and consistently applying the attributes utilizing the ate Job Aid and tools such as the IRM and Internal Revenue Code • Completing timely case reviews using the Data Collection Instrument (DCI) • Completing timely and accurate input of review data into the NQRS database • Identifying the appropriate reason code(s) for each not met attribute rating • Writing clear and meaningful attribute narrative comments for each met attribute rating • Elevating potential conﬂicts in the IRM and the Job Aid for resolution • Assisting in data analysis as warranted (
) Program reports are available on NQRS by selecting Reports from the main menu screen. (

) FSEQ also generates quarterly performance reports for stakeholders. reports provide data to aid in: • Establishing baselines to assess program performance • Identifying quality strengths and weaknesses • Determining speciﬁc training/educational needs • Identifying opportunities to improve work processes • Measuring the success of quality improvement efforts (
) An overall quality score serves as the Balanced Measure for Business – Quality. This measure is reported to various levels of the organization and external stakeholders such as Congress. (

) Access to EQRS and NQRS data and reports is controlled based on the assigned permission level, assigned function and assigned organization. System coordinators are responsible for assigning users to the appropriate permission level based on the user’s role in the organization. Users are given privileges that are required for the user to perform their jobs. Users not have access to security and other functions/features that require privileges. (
) Access to EQRS and NQRS is through the Business Entitlement Access Request System (BEARS) at https://bears.iam.int.for.irs.gov/home/Index. (

) EQRS/NQRS systems contain input validation checks to ensure input and completeness by: • Restricting data input to established system parameters to ensure accuracy • Using drop down lists as much as possible to restrict users from invalid information • Displaying an error message if invalid data is input into the system • Requiring data ﬁeld input before proceeding (
) Operations Support, Technology Solutions, Collection Systems provide core information technology management and support services for both EQRS NQRS. They are responsible for:

and consistently applying the attributes utilizing the Job Aid and tools such as the IRM and Internal Revenue Code timely case reviews using the Data Collection Instrument timely and accurate input of review data into the NQRS the appropriate reason code(s) for each not met attribute clear and meaningful attribute narrative comments for each attribute rating potential conﬂicts in the IRM and the Job Aid for resolution in data analysis as warranted

) Field and Specialty Exam job aids are reference tools used by Field and Specialty Exam management and FSEQ review staff to aid in rating the attributes in a uniform and consistent manner. Guidelines in the job aids the EQ concepts to current Field and Specialty Exam procedures. IRM ences support each quality attribute. (

) Headquarters Examination, Examination Field and Campus Policy is sible for ensuring the consistency of the Field and Office Exam job aids training materials, along with the IRM and other guidelines. (
) Headquarters Examination, Specialty Policy is responsible for ensuring consistency of the Specialty Exam job aids and training materials, along the IRM and other guidelines. (
) Links to the job aids may be found on the Quality Knowledge Base which located at https://portal.ds.irsnet.gov/sites/vl
/pages/default.aspx. (
) The quality review process provides data to measure, monitor and quality of work. (
) Organizational performance is measured by conducting independent case reviews from a statistically valid sample of examination case work. (
) Speciﬁc measurement criteria, referred to as quality attributes, are used evaluate the quality of case work. (

) Quality attributes address whether: • Timely service was provided to the taxpayer • Facts of the case were properly analyzed • Law was correctly applied • Taxpayer rights were protected by following applicable IRS policies procedures including timeliness, adequacy of notiﬁcations, and contacts with taxpayers • Appropriate determination was reached regarding liability for tax (

) Quality attributes are organized into measurement categories which allow quality data to be generated based on the following criteria: • Timeliness - resolving issues in the most efficient manner through proper time utilization and workload management techniques Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.

(10-06-2020) Evaluating and Coding the Attributes
The scoring system provides for the equal weighting of each attribute. Each attribute is rated as Yes, No, or in some instances Not Applicable.

Either a physical or electronic case may be assigned for review. If a physical case ﬁle is assigned for review, the physical case ﬁle is the primary source.

special tracking for local or national purposes Process Measures data may be analyzed in conjunction with the quality butes. Process Measures data ﬁelds capture:
Speciﬁc tasks performed during the examination

Hours associated with the case When a quality attribute is rated not met, at least one reason code, if must be selected that supports the not met rating. The most appropriate reason code should be selected for the error. reason codes may be selected for multiple errors, if warranted. A narrative is required, describing the facts, for each not met attribute Reviewers should contact their manager when other is used regularly as reason code to determine if additional reason codes should be added to NQRS. Reviewer narratives must be thorough, providing clear, concise, and descriptions of any errors, offering sufficient detail to allow for speciﬁc mendations for improvement. Reviewers must avoid using canned statements in their narratives. Attribute narratives should:
Clearly state the facts that resulted in the attribute rating
Identify the nature of the error in the ﬁrst sentence of the narrative
Indicate what was not done, not what should have been done
Evaluate the case, not the examiner Reviewer should not include taxpayer speciﬁc or Personally Identiﬁable mation (PII) data in the narrative comments.

) The Examination Record Control System (ERCS) Sample Review program automates the process of randomly selecting a valid sample of cases the sampling criteria for review. (
) The sample size is statistically valid at the Field Exam Area level and the Specialty Exam Program level. The annual sample plan is based on ﬁscal year closures for each SB/SE program. (

) Cases meeting the sample criteria are selected by the ERCS Sample program at the designated sample rate for the Field Exam Area and for of the Specialty Exam Programs (Excise, Employment, Estate and Gift). are subject to the sample at the point they move to Status Code
(In to Centralized Case Processing) or
(In transit to Technical Services). cases are not controlled on ERCS. See IRM
, BSA Case Selection Procedures, for more information.

reliable and meaningful results. (
) The FSEQ front-line manager should periodically perform consistency to ensure consistent and accurate application of the quality attributes and accurate data input. (

) The FSEQ front-line manager may conduct consistency reviews in several ways, including: • Have each reviewer independently review the same case and any inconsistencies in attribute rating • Critique completed case reviews and provide feedback to reinforce pectations of the review outcomes • Utilize NQRS reports including reviewer narratives, to evaluate tency, ensure guidelines are followed and ensure the narratives are clearly and professionally written • Hold group meetings to discuss speciﬁc attributes and case (
) Results of the consistency reviews are maintained and updated as (
) The fundamental purpose of the National Quality Review program is to an overall organizational assessment of case quality. of (

) Quality review results are statistically valid and reliable measurements of Review overall quality of casework completed by SB/SE Field Exam only at the level. Specialty Exam national quality results are statistically valid at the program level. Results stratiﬁed to any lower organizational segment are statistically reliable measurements of the quality of casework at those (
) Lower organizational segment stratiﬁcations are indicators. They should relied upon only to the extent that they are conﬁrmed by other reliable agement measures of quality. (
) The design and format of quality review reports within NQRS as well as access to the reports and data will be determined by the Field and Exam program manager. (
) No attempt should be made to associate speciﬁc review results to a case. (

) Review data is used to assess program performance and will not be used evaluate individual employee performance. Any feedback or other data generated from NQRS will not be used as a substitute for EQRS case on the job visits, workload or any other reviews. (
) FSEQ reviewers will follow guidance found in the Technical Services IRM
,Returning Cases to the Field, which outlines return criteria for Case Return with potential for signiﬁcant impact to taxpayer compliance or to tax (
) SEQ reviewers will also follow guidance found in the Technical Services
’Returning Cases to the Field, which outlines return criteria for Exam Case with potential for signiﬁcant impact to taxpayer compliance or to tax
Have each reviewer independently review the same case and discuss any inconsistencies in attribute rating
Critique completed case reviews and provide feedback to reinforce ex
pectations of the review outcomes
Utilize NQRS reports including reviewer narratives, to evaluate consis
tency, ensure guidelines are followed and ensure the narratives are clearly and professionally written
Hold group meetings to discuss speciﬁc attributes and case scenarios

SEQ reviewers will also follow guidance found in the Technical Services IRM 4.8.2.9’Returning Cases to the Field, which outlines return criteria for cases with potential for signiﬁcant impact to taxpayer compliance or to tax revenues.
4.2 General Examining Procedures
) Additional guidance is provided for SEQ for cases that do not close to Technical Services. (
) SEQ reviewer will take the following actions for Employment, Estate and Gift and Excise cases meeting the case return criteria found in IRM

Return Criteria • Prepare case return memo. The memo will address the facts, law, recommended actions needed for the case. • Consult with Specialty Exam Policy Subject Matter Expert (SME) to resolve any technical issues relating to the case if warranted. • Forward case return memo to the SEQ front-line manager for concur- rence. (
) SEQ front-line manager will send case return memo to the quality analyst concurrence. (

) The quality analyst will send the case return memo to the Specialty ﬁeld line manager with a copy to the territory manager, program policy analyst responsible for quality and ﬁeld technical advisor. (
) The Specialty ﬁeld front-line manager will provide SEQ front-line manager shipping instructions. (
) SEQ reviewer will ship case per instructions from Specialty ﬁeld group front- line manager following current shipping guidelines. Note: Document all case return actions in the case ﬁle.
SEQ reviewer will take the following actions for Employment, Estate and Gift and Excise cases meeting the case return criteria found in IRM 4.8.2.9.1

Prepare case return memo. The memo will address the facts, law, recommended actions needed for the case. Consult with Specialty Exam Policy Subject Matter Expert (SME) to resolve any technical issues relating to the case if warranted. Forward case return memo to the SEQ front
line manager for concur
rence.
SEQ reviewer will ship case per instructions from Specialty ﬁeld group front- line manager following current shipping guidelines.
Note: Document all case return actions in the case ﬁle.
The returned case will remain in Status Code

, Closed. The decision to act on the SEQ reviewer recommendations is the responsibility of the Specialty ﬁeld front-line and territory manager. The Specialty ﬁeld front-line manager is responsible for shipping the case to ﬁles once any needed actions are completed. Document all follow-up actions in the case ﬁle.

Measured To - End of the exam action or activity
